55.verse: And when a south wind is blowing, you say, ‘It will be a scorcher’—and so it is.

56.verse: Hypocrites! The surface of the earth and sky you know how to interpret yet you don’t know how to interpret this present time?

57.verse: Why can’t you judge for yourselves what is right?

58.verse: For while you are going with your accuser to the authorities, make an effort to come to a settlement with him—so he doesn’t drag you before the judge, and the judge hand you over to the officer of the court, and the officer of the court throw you into prison.

59.verse: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid back the last little bit.”

1.verse: Now there were some present at the same time who told Yeshua about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.

2.verse: He answered and said to them, “Do you suppose that these Galileans are worse sinners than the rest of the Galileans because they have suffered these things?

3.verse: No, I tell you! But unless you repent, you all will perish the same way.

4.verse: “Or those eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell and were killed, do you suppose that they are worse sinners than all the people living in Jerusalem?

5.verse: No, I tell you! But unless you repent, you all will perish the same way.

6.verse: Then Yeshua began telling this parable: “A man had a fig tree he had planted in his vineyard, and he came looking for fruit on it and found none.

7.verse: So he said to the gardener, ‘Indeed, for three years I‘ve come searching for fruit on this fig tree and found none. Remove it! Why does it use up the ground?’

8.verse: “But answering, the gardener said to him, ‘Master, leave it alone for this year also, until I dig around it and apply fertilizer.

9.verse: And if it bears fruit, good. But if not, cut it down.’”

10.verse: Teaching by Example at the Synagogue - Now Yeshua was teaching in one of the synagogues on Shabbat.

11.verse: And behold, there was a woman with a disabling spirit for eighteen years, bent over and completely unable to stand up straight.

12.verse: When Yeshua saw her, He called out to her and said, “Woman, you are set free from your disability.”

13.verse: Then He laid hands on her, and instantly she stood up straight and began praising God.

14.verse: But the synagogue leader, indignant that Yeshua had healed on Shabbat, started telling the crowd, “There are six days in which work should be done—so come to be healed on those days and not on Yom Shabbat!”

15.verse: But the Lord answered him and said, “Hypocrites! On Shabbat doesn’t each of you untie his ox or donkey from the stall and lead it away to give it drink?

16.verse: So this one, a daughter of Abraham incapacitated by satan for eighteen years, shouldn’t she be set free from this imprisonment on Yom Shabbat?”

17.verse: When Yeshua said these things, all His opponents were put to shame; but the whole crowd was rejoicing at all the glorious things done by Him.

18.verse: Teaching throughout the Towns and Villages - So Yeshua was saying, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

19.verse: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and dropped into his own garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”

20.verse: Again He said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?

21.verse: It is like hametz, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.

22.verse: And He continued on His journey through the towns and villages, teaching and making His way to Jerusalem.

23.verse: And someone said to Him, “Master, are only a few being saved?” Then Yeshua said to them,

24.verse: “Make every effort to enter through the narrow door; for many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able.

25.verse: Once the Master of the household gets up and shuts the door, and you’re standing outside and begin knocking on the door, saying, ‘Master, open up for us,’ then He will say to you, ‘I don’t know where you come from.’

26.verse: Then you will start to say, ‘We ate and drank in Your company, and You taught in our streets.’

27.verse: But He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Get away from Me, all of you evildoers!’”

28.verse: “There will be weeping and the gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.

29.verse: And they will come from the east and west and from the north and south, and they will recline at table in the kingdom of God.

30.verse: And indeed, some are last who shall be first, and some are first who shall be last.”

31.verse: A Warning to Move On - In that hour, some Pharisees came up and said to Yeshua, “Get out and leave from here, because Herod wants to kill You!”

32.verse: But Yeshua said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Indeed, I’m driving out demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach My goal.’

33.verse: But I must keep going today and tomorrow because it just can’t be that a prophet would perish outside Jerusalem.

34.verse: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem who kills the prophets and stones those sent to her! How often I longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing.

35.verse: Look, your house is left to you desolate! For I tell you, you will never see Me until you say, ‘Baruch ha-ba b’shem ADONAI. Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’”

1.verse: A Dinner Conversation on Shabbat - Now when Yeshua went into the home of one of the leaders of the Pharisees to eat a meal on Shabbat, they were watching Him closely.

2.verse: And there before Him was a man swollen with fluid.

3.verse: So Yeshua said to the Torah lawyers and the Pharisees, “Is it permitted to heal on Shabbat, or not?”

4.verse: But they kept silent. So Yeshua took hold of him and healed him, and He sent him away.

5.verse: Then He said to them, “Which of you, with a son or an ox falling into a well on Yom Shabbat, will not immediately pull him out?”

6.verse: And they could not reply to these things.

7.verse: Yeshua began telling a parable to those who had been invited, when He noticed how they were choosing the seats of honor. He said to them,

8.verse: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding, don’t take the seat of honor, for someone more highly esteemed than you may have been invited by him.

9.verse: Then the one who invited both of you will come to you and say, ‘Give up this seat.’ And with shame, you would proceed to take the lowest seat.

10.verse: But when you are invited, go and recline in the lowest seat so that when the one who invited you comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you shall be honored in the presence of all those who are dining with you.

11.verse: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

12.verse: Then Yeshua was also saying to the one who invited Him, “When you host a luncheon or dinner, don’t invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or rich neighbors. Otherwise they might invite you in return as your payback.

13.verse: But when you host a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind;

14.verse: and you will be blessed, since they cannot repay you. You will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous.”

15.verse: Now hearing this, one of those dining with Yeshua said to Him, “Blessed is he who eats bread in the kingdom of God.”

16.verse: But Yeshua said to him, “A certain man was hosting a large banquet, and he invited many.

17.verse: At the time for the banquet, he sent his slave to tell those who had been invited, ‘Come, everything is already prepared.’

18.verse: “But every one of them began to beg off. The first said to him, ‘I bought a farm, and I’m obligated to go out to see it. I’m asking you to have me excused.’

19.verse: Then another one said, ‘I’ve purchased five teams of oxen, and I’m going to check them out. I’m asking you to have me excused.’

20.verse: Still another said, ‘I’ve married a wife, so I cannot come.’

21.verse: “The slave came and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house got angry and said to his slave, ‘Quickly go out into the squares and alleys of the city and bring here the poor, the maimed, the blind, and the lame.’

22.verse: “And the slave said, ‘Master, I have done as you instructed, and still there is room.’

23.verse: “So the master said to the slave, ‘Go out into the thoroughfares and fenced areas, and press them to come in so my home may be filled.

24.verse: For I tell you, none of those men who were invited will taste my banquet.’”

25.verse: Telling Parables Along the Road - Now great crowds were traveling with Yeshua; and He turned and said to them,

26.verse: “If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters—and yes, even his own life—he cannot be My disciple.

27.verse: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow Me cannot be My disciple.

28.verse: “For which of you, wanting to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and figure out the cost, to see if he has enough to finish it?

29.verse: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and isn’t able to finish everything, all who see it begin to mock him,

30.verse: saying, ‘This man began to build and wasn’t able to finish!’

31.verse: “Or what king, going to make war against another king, won’t first sit down to consider whether he is able with ten thousand to confront the one coming against him with twenty thousand?

32.verse: If not, while the other is still far away, he sends an ambassador and asks for peace.

33.verse: So in the same way, whoever does not renounce all that he has, cannot be My disciple.

34.verse: “Therefore, salt is good; but if the salt should lose its flavor, how shall it be made salty again?

35.verse: It is not suitable for the soil or for a manure heap—it is thrown out. The one who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

1.verse: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were drawing near to hear Yeshua.

2.verse: The Pharisees and the Torah scholars began to complain, saying, ‘This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”

3.verse: So He told this parable to them, saying,

4.verse: “Which man among you, if he has a hundred sheep and loses one of them, will not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the lost one until he finds it?

5.verse: When he has found it, he puts it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

6.verse: And when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors and says, ‘Rejoice with me, for I’ve found my sheep that was lost!’

7.verse: I tell you, in the same way there will be more joy in heaven over one repenting sinner than over the ninety-nine righteous people who have no need of repentance.”

8.verse: “Or which woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one coin, does not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search thoroughly until she finds it?

9.verse: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I’ve found the coin I had lost!’

10.verse: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”

11.verse: Then Yeshua said, “A certain man had two sons,

12.verse: and the younger of them said to the father, ‘Father, give me the share of the property that comes to me.’ So he divided his wealth between them.

13.verse: “Not many days later, the younger son gathered everything and traveled to a far country, and there he squandered his inheritance on wild living.

14.verse: Now when he had spent everything, a severe famine came against that country, and he began to be in need.

15.verse: So he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

16.verse: And he was longing to fill up on the carob pods the pigs were eating, but no one was giving him any.

17.verse: “But when he came to his senses, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired workers have food overflowing, but here I am dying of hunger!

18.verse: I’ll get up and go to my father, and I’ll say to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your presence.

19.verse: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired workers.

20.verse: “And he got up and went to his own father. But while he was still far away, his father saw him and felt compassion. He ran and fell on his neck and kissed him.

21.verse: Then the son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your presence. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’

22.verse: “But the father said to his slaves, ‘Quick! Bring out the best robe and put it on him! Put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet.

23.verse: Bring the fattened calf and kill it! Let’s celebrate with a feast!

24.verse: For this son of mine was dead and has come back to life—he was lost and is found!’ Then they began to celebrate.

25.verse: “Now his older son was out in the field. And as he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.

26.verse: And he called out to one of the servants and began to ask what these things could be.

27.verse: “The servant said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf because he got him back safe and sound.’

28.verse: “But the older son was angry and didn’t want to go in. So his father came outside and pleaded with him.

29.verse: But he answered and said to his father, ‘Look, so many years I’ve slaved away for you—not once did I ignore your order. Yet you’ve never given me a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.

30.verse: But when this son of yours came—the one who has squandered your wealth with prostitutes—for him you killed the fattened calf!”

31.verse: “Then the father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and everything that is mine is yours.

32.verse: But it was right to celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead but has come back to life! He was lost, but is found.’”

1.verse: A Lesson for the Disciples - Now Yeshua was also saying to the disciples, “There was a rich man who had a household manager, and this manager was accused of squandering his belongings.

2.verse: So he called the manager and said to him, ‘What’s this I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, because you cannot be manager any longer.’

3.verse: “Then the manager said to himself, ‘What shall I do, since my master is taking the management away from me? I’m not strong enough to dig; I’m ashamed to beg.

4.verse: I know what I’ll do, so that when I’m put out of management others will welcome me into their homes.’

5.verse: So he called in each one of his master’s debtors, and he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’

6.verse: “He said, ‘One hundred units of olive oil.’ “The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write fifty.’

7.verse: Then he said to another, ‘Now how much do you owe?’ “He said, ‘A hundred units of wheat.’ “The manager said to him, ‘Take your bill and write eighty.’

8.verse: “Now the master praised the crooked manager because he had acted shrewdly, for the sons of this age are smarter when dealing with their own generation than the sons of light.

9.verse: I say to you, make friends for yourselves from the wealth of the world, so when it runs out, they will welcome you into the eternal shelters.

10.verse: “One who is faithful in the smallest matters is also faithful in much, and the one unjust in the smallest matters will likewise be unjust in much.

11.verse: So then, if you cannot be trusted with unjust wealth, who will trust you with true wealth?

12.verse: Now if you have not been trustworthy with what belongs to another, who will give you anything of your own?

13.verse: No servant can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will stick by one and look down on the other. You cannot serve God and money.”

14.verse: The Pharisees Listen In - Now the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, were listening to all these things and sneering at Yeshua.

15.verse: But He said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves before the people, but God knows your hearts. For what is prized among men is detestable in God’s sight.”

16.verse: “The Torah and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since then, the Good News of the kingdom of God is being proclaimed, and everyone tries forcing his way in.

17.verse: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for a single serif of the Torah to fail.

18.verse: Everyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery. And he who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.

19.verse: “Now there was a rich man dressed in purple and fine linen, living it up in luxury every day.

20.verse: But a poor man named Lazarus had been laid at his gate, covered with sores

21.verse: and longing to be fed with what fell from the rich man’s table. Besides, even the dogs were coming to lick his sores.

22.verse: “It happened that the poor man died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s side. Then the rich man also died and was buried.

23.verse: And from Sheol, as he was in torment, he raised his eyes. And he sees Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his side.

24.verse: So he cried out and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! And send Lazarus so he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool off my tongue, because I am suffering torment in this flame.’

25.verse: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that in your life you received your good things, even as Lazarus received the bad things. But now he is comforted here, and you are tormented.

26.verse: Besides all this, between us and you a great chasm is firmly set, so that those who want to cross over to you cannot, nor can those from there cross over to us.

27.verse: “Then the rich man said, ‘I beg you then, Father Abraham, send Lazarus to my father’s house!

28.verse: For I have five brothers to warn, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.’

29.verse: “But Abraham says, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them listen to them.’

30.verse: “But he said, ‘No, Father Abraham, but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’

31.verse: “But Abraham said, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be convinced even if someone rises from the dead!’”

1.verse: Back to Teaching His Own - Then Yeshua said to His disciples, “Stumbling blocks are bound to come, but woe to the one by whom they come!

2.verse: It would be better for him to have a millstone put around his neck and to be hurled into the sea, than for him to cause one of these little ones to stumble.

3.verse: “Keep yourselves alert! If your brother sins, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.

4.verse: Even if he sins against you seven times a day, and seven times returns to you, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”

5.verse: Then the emissaries said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”

6.verse: Then the Lord said, “If you have faith like a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

7.verse: But if you have a slave who is plowing or tending sheep, who among you will say to him when he comes in from the field, ‘Come right in, and recline at table’?

8.verse: But won’t he instead say to him, ‘Prepare something for me to eat! Dress yourself and wait on me while I eat and drink; and afterward, you may eat and drink’?

9.verse: He doesn’t thank the slave because he did what he was commanded, does he?

10.verse: So you too, when you’ve done everything you are commanded, say, ‘We are unworthy slaves. We have done only what we were supposed to do.’”

11.verse: On the Move through Samaria - Now while going up to Jerusalem, Yeshua was passing between Samaria and the Galilee.

12.verse: As He entered a certain village, ten men with tzara’at came toward Him. They stood some distance away

13.verse: and raised their voices, saying, “Yeshua, Master, have mercy on us!”

14.verse: When He saw them, He said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the kohanim.” And as they went, they were cleansed.

15.verse: Now one of them, when he saw that he was healed, came back, glorifying God with a loud voice.

16.verse: And he fell at Yeshua’s feet, facedown, giving Him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.

17.verse: Then Yeshua answered and said, “Weren’t ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

18.verse: Weren’t any found who came back to give glory to God except this foreigner?”

19.verse: Then Yeshua said to the man, “Stand up and go! Your faith has made you well.”

20.verse: Now when Yeshua was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them and said, “The kingdom of God does not come with signs to be seen.

21.verse: Nor will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘There!’ For behold, the kingdom of God is in your midst.”

22.verse: Then Yeshua said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

23.verse: They will say to you, ‘Look, there!’ or ‘Look, here!’ Do not go and chase after them.

24.verse: For just as the lightning flashes from one part of the sky and lights up another part, so will the Son of Man be in His day.

25.verse: But first He must suffer much and be rejected by this generation.

26.verse: As it was in the days of Noah, so will it also be in the days of the Son of Man.

27.verse: They were eating, drinking, marrying, and being given in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.

28.verse: “It was just the same in the days of Lot. They were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building.

29.verse: But on the day Lot left Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from heaven and destroyed them all.

30.verse: Things will be the same on the day when the Son of Man is made fully known.

31.verse: In that day, the one who is on the roof, and his possessions in the house, must not go down to take them away. In the same way, the one who is in the field must not turn back.

32.verse: Remember Lot’s wife!

33.verse: Whoever tries to keep his life will lose it; but whoever loses his life will preserve it.

34.verse: “I tell you, on that night there will be two in one bed. One will be taken along and the other left.

35.verse: There will be two women grinding at the same place. One will be taken and the other left.”

37.verse: “Where, Lord?” they replied. And He said to them, “Where there is a corpse, there also will the vultures be gathered.”

1.verse: Then Yeshua told them a parable to show that they should always pray and not be discouraged,

2.verse: He said, “There was a judge in a certain city who neither feared God nor respected people.

3.verse: And there was a widow in that city who kept coming to him, saying, ‘Give me justice against my opponent.’

4.verse: “He was unwilling at the time. But afterward he said to himself, ‘Although I don’t fear God or respect people,

5.verse: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will give her justice so she won’t wear me out by her incessant coming.’”

6.verse: Then the Lord said, “Hear what the unjust judge is saying.

7.verse: Won’t God do justice for His chosen ones, who cry out to Him day and night? Will He be slow to help them?

8.verse: I tell you, He will quickly give them justice. But when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”

9.verse: Then Yeshua spoke this parable to some who trusted in themselves that they were righteous, while holding others in contempt.

10.verse: “Two men went up to the Temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.

11.verse: The Pharisee stood and was praying this to himself: ‘O God, I thank You that I am not like other people—thieving, unjust, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

12.verse: I fast twice a week and tithe on all that I get.’

13.verse: “But the tax collector, standing some distance away, wouldn’t even lift his eyes toward heaven, but beat his chest, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, the sinner!’

14.verse: I tell you, this man, rather than the other, went down to his home declared righteous. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

15.verse: Now they were bringing even their babies to Yeshua, so He might touch them. But when the disciples saw this, they began rebuking them.

16.verse: But Yeshua called for them, saying, “Let the little children come to Me and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

17.verse: Amen, I tell you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”

18.verse: And a religious leader inquired of Yeshua, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

19.verse: “Why are you calling Me good?” Yeshua said to him. “No one is good except One—that is God.

20.verse: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.’”

21.verse: The man said, “All these I have kept since my youth.”

22.verse: When Yeshua heard this, He said to him, “One thing you still lack. Sell all, as much as you have, and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow Me.”

23.verse: But upon hearing these things, he became deeply distressed, for he was very rich.

24.verse: Gazing at him, Yeshua said, “How hard it is for the rich to enter into the kingdom of God!

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: Then those who heard said, “Then who can be saved?”

27.verse: But Yeshua said, “What is impossible with men is possible with God.”

28.verse: Then Peter said, “Look, we’ve left everything of our own to follow You.”

29.verse: And Yeshua said to them, “Amen, I tell you, there is no one who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God,

30.verse: who will not receive many times as much in this age; and in the olam ha-ba, eternal life.”

31.verse: Then Yeshua took the twelve aside and said to them, “Look, we’re going up to Jerusalem, and everything written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be carried out.

32.verse: He will be handed over to the Gentiles, and He will be mocked and insulted and spat upon.

33.verse: After they have scourged Him, they will kill Him. Yet on the third day, He will rise again.”

34.verse: But they understood none of these things; this message was hidden from them, and they did not understand what He was saying.

35.verse: Approaching Jericho - Now as Yeshua was approaching Jericho, a certain blind man was sitting by the road, begging.

36.verse: But when he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.

37.verse: They told him that Yeshua ha-Natzrati was passing by.

38.verse: And he cried out, saying, “Yeshua, Ben-David, have mercy on me!”

39.verse: And those leading the way were scolding him, so he would be quiet. But he kept shouting all the more, “Ben-David, have mercy on me!”

40.verse: So Yeshua stopped and ordered the blind man to be brought to Him. And when he came near, Yeshua asked him,

41.verse: “What do you want Me to do for you?” And he said, “Master, I want to see again!”

42.verse: Yeshua said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has made you well.”

43.verse: Immediately the man received his sight and began following Yeshua, glorifying God. And when all the people saw it, they also gave praise to God.

1.verse: Visiting Zacchaeus in Jericho - Now Yeshua entered Jericho and was passing through.

2.verse: And here was a man by the name of Zacchaeus; he was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

3.verse: Zacchaeus was trying to see who Yeshua was, but he couldn’t because of the crowd, for he was short in height.

4.verse: So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Yeshua, for He was about to pass through that way.

5.verse: When Yeshua came to the place, He looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.”

6.verse: Zacchaeus hurried and came down and welcomed Him joyfully.

7.verse: But when everyone saw it, they began to grumble, saying, “Yeshua has gone to be the guest of a sinner!”

8.verse: But Zacchaeus stood there and said to the Lord. “Look, Master, half of my possessions I give to the poor, and if I have somehow cheated anyone, I repay four times as much!”

9.verse: Then Yeshua said to him, “Today salvation has come to this home, because he also is a son of Abraham.

10.verse: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”

11.verse: As they were listening to this, Yeshua went on to tell a parable, because He was near Jerusalem and they supposed that the kingdom of God was about to appear at once.

12.verse: Therefore He said, “A certain nobleman went to a faraway land to receive for himself a kingdom and then return.

13.verse: And calling ten of his own slaves, he gave them ten minas and said to them, ‘Do business until I come back.’

14.verse: But his citizens detested him and they sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this fellow to reign over us!’

15.verse: When he returned after receiving the kingdom, he called for those slaves to whom he had given the money. He wanted to know how much business they had done.

16.verse: Now the first appeared, saying, ‘Master, your one mina has made ten.’

17.verse: The master said to him, ‘Well done, good slave! Because you were faithful with so little, take charge over ten cities.’

18.verse: Also, the second slave came, saying, ‘Your mina, Master, made five.’

19.verse: Then he also said to this one, ‘You are likewise over five cities.’

20.verse: But another came, saying, ‘Master, here is your mina. I was keeping it safe in a handkerchief,

21.verse: for I was afraid of you because you are a strict man. You take what you did not make and reap what you did not sow.’

22.verse: He said to him, ‘By the words of your own mouth I will judge you, you wicked slave! You knew that I am strict, taking what I did not make and reaping what I did not sow?

23.verse: Then why didn’t you put my money in the bank, so that when I came back I could have collected it with interest?’

24.verse: Then to the bystanders he said, ‘Take the mina from him, and give it to the one who has ten minas.’

25.verse: But they said to him, ‘Sir, he has ten minas!’

26.verse: ‘I tell you, to everyone who has, more shall be given. But from the one who doesn’t have, even what he does have shall be taken away.

27.verse: But those hostile to me, who didn’t want me to reign over them, bring them here and execute them before me.’”

28.verse: Riding into Jerusalem - After saying these things, Yeshua was going on ahead, up to Jerusalem.

29.verse: When He got near Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, He sent two of the disciples,

30.verse: saying, “Go into the village ahead. As you enter, you will find a colt tied up, that no one has ever sat upon. Untie it and bring it.

31.verse: And if anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you shall say, ‘The Master needs it.’”

32.verse: Those who were headed out found things just as He told them.

33.verse: Then as they were untying the colt, his owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

34.verse: They said, “The Master needs it.”

35.verse: Then they brought it to Yeshua, threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Yeshua on it.

36.verse: And as He went along, the people were spreading their cloaks on the road.

37.verse: When Yeshua came near the slope of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began to rejoice. They praised God with a loud voice for all the miracles they had seen,

38.verse: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of ADONAI! Shalom in heaven and glory in the highest!”

39.verse: Some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples!”

40.verse: But answering, Yeshua said, “I tell you that if these keep silent, the stones will shout out!”

41.verse: As He drew near and saw Jerusalem, He wept over her,

42.verse: saying, “If only you had recognized this day the things that lead to shalom! But now they are hidden from your eyes.

43.verse: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will surround you with barricades and hem you in on all sides.

44.verse: And they will smash you to the ground—you and your children within you. And they won’t leave within you one stone upon another, because you did not recognize the time of your visitation.”

45.verse: Confrontation at the Temple - Then Yeshua entered the Temple and began to drive out the merchants,

46.verse: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’”

47.verse: And He was teaching every day in the Temple. The ruling kohanim and the Torah scholars, even the leaders of the people, were trying to destroy Him;

48.verse: but they could not find any way to do it, because all the people were hanging on His words.

1.verse: On one of the days while Yeshua was teaching the people in the Temple and proclaiming the Good News, the ruling kohanim and the Torah scholars, together with the elders, confronted Him.

2.verse: And they spoke, saying to Him, “Tell us by what authority are You doing these things? Or who is the one who gave You this authority?”

3.verse: But answering, Yeshua said to them, “I also will ask you a question, and you tell Me:

4.verse: the immersion of John—was it from heaven or from men?”

5.verse: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’

6.verse: But if we say, ‘From men,’ then all the people will stone us, because they are convinced that John is a prophet.”

7.verse: So they answered that they didn’t know where it came from.

8.verse: And Yeshua said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

9.verse: Then He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey for a long time.

10.verse: And at the season, he sent a servant to the tenants so that they would give him part of the vineyard’s fruit. But the tenants beat him up and sent him away empty-handed.

11.verse: So he proceeded to send another servant. They beat him too and treated him shamefully, and they sent him away empty-handed.

12.verse: And he proceeded to send a third one. They wounded this one too, and they threw him out.

13.verse: “Now the master of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my son, whom I love. Probably they will show him respect.’

14.verse: But when the tenants saw him, they discussed the matter among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir! Let’s kill him so the inheritance will be ours.’

15.verse: So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the master of the vineyard do to them?

16.verse: He will come and destroy those tenants and give the vineyard to others.” But when they heard this, they said, “May it never happen!”

17.verse: Then Yeshua looked right at them and said, “Then what is this that has been written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, this has become the chief cornerstone’?

18.verse: Everyone who falls on that stone will be shattered; but the one upon whom it falls, it will crush him.”

19.verse: The Torah scholars and the ruling kohanim tried to grab Him that very hour, because they realized that He spoke this parable against them—but they feared the people.

20.verse: Silencing the Opposition - Now they watched Him and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, in order to trap Him in His words so they could hand Him over to the power and authority of the governor.

21.verse: And they asked Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You tell it straight and You teach it straight. You show no partiality, but teach the way of God according to the truth.

22.verse: Is it permitted for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

23.verse: But carefully considering their treachery, Yeshua said to them,

24.verse: “Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?” And they said, “Caesar’s.”

25.verse: Then He said to them, “Well then, give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

26.verse: And they could not trap Him in His words in the presence of the people. Astonished by His answer, they kept silent.

27.verse: Then some of the Sadducees (who deny there is a resurrection) came and questioned Yeshua.

28.verse: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that ‘if a man’s brother dies’ having a wife ‘but no children, then his brother should take the widow and father children for his brother.’

29.verse: Now there were seven brothers, and the first took a wife and died childless;

30.verse: and the second

31.verse: and the third took her, but in this same way, each of the seven brothers died and left no children.

32.verse: Finally the woman died too.

33.verse: So in the resurrection, whose wife is she? For all seven had married her.

34.verse: Yeshua said to them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage.

35.verse: But those considered worthy to reach the olam ha-ba and the resurrection of the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.

36.verse: For they can no longer die, because they are like angels and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection.

37.verse: But at the burning bush even Moses revealed that the dead are raised, when he calls ADONAI ‘the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

38.verse: Now He is God not of the dead but of the living, for to Him they all are living.”

39.verse: Some of the Torah scholars replied, “Teacher, You have said it well.”

40.verse: For they no longer dared to question Him about anything.

41.verse: Then Yeshua said to them, “How can they say that the Messiah is Ben-David?

42.verse: For David himself says in the Book of Psalms, ‘ADONAI said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand,

43.verse: until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”’

44.verse: David then calls Him ‘Lord’; so how is He his son?”

45.verse: Then with all the people listening, Yeshua said to the disciples,

46.verse: “Beware of the Torah scholars, who like to walk around in long robes. They love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and places of honor at feasts.

47.verse: They devour widows’ houses and make long prayers as a show. These men will receive greater condemnation!”

1.verse: Teaching in the Temple - Then Yeshua looked up and saw the rich dropping their gifts into the treasury box.

2.verse: He also saw a poor widow dropping in two small copper coins.

3.verse: And He said, “Truly I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all the rest.

4.verse: For all these put in their gifts from their surplus. But she, out of her poverty, put in all she had to live on.”

5.verse: And while some were talking about the Temple, how it was decorated with beautiful stones and offerings, Yeshua said,

6.verse: “As for these things you are looking at, the days will come when not one stone will be left upon another. Every one will be torn down!”

7.verse: And they questioned Him, saying, “Teacher, so when will these things happen? What will be the sign that these things are about to take place?”

8.verse: And He said, “Watch out that you are not led astray! For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He’ and ‘The time is near!’ Do not follow them.

9.verse: And when you hear of wars and chaos, do not be terrorized. For these things need to happen first, but the end will not come at once.”

10.verse: Then He continued telling them, “Nation will rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

11.verse: There will be great earthquakes along with famines and epidemics in various places, and there will be terrors along with great signs from heaven.

12.verse: But before all these things, they will grab you and persecute you, handing you over to the synagogues and prisons, and leading you away to kings and governors on account of My name.

13.verse: This will lead you to be a witness.

14.verse: So make up your minds not to prepare ahead of time to defend yourselves—

15.verse: for I Myself will give you speech and wisdom that none of your opponents will be able to resist or refute.

16.verse: But you will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends—and they will put some of you to death.

17.verse: And you will be hated by all because of My name.

18.verse: Yet not a hair of your head will be lost.

19.verse: By your endurance, you will gain your souls.

20.verse: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then recognize that her desolation is near.

21.verse: Then those in Judea must flee to the mountains, and those inside the city must get out, and those in the countryside must not enter her.

22.verse: For these are the days of punishment, to fulfill all that has been written.

23.verse: “Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath on this people.

24.verse: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be led away captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

25.verse: “There will be signs in the sun and moon and stars. And upon the earth nations will be confused by the roaring of the sea and its waves.

26.verse: People will lose heart from fear and anticipation of what is overtaking the earth, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

27.verse: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

28.verse: Now when these things begin to happen, stand straight and lift up your heads, because your salvation is near!”

29.verse: Then Yeshua told them a parable: “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.

30.verse: As soon as they sprout their leaves, you see it and you know at once that summer is near.

31.verse: So also, when you see these all these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.

32.verse: Amen, I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

33.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will never pass away.

34.verse: “But watch out so your hearts are not weighed down by carousing, strong drink, and the worries of life. Do not let that day come upon you suddenly like a trap.

35.verse: For it will come rushing upon all who live on the face of the whole earth.

36.verse: But stay alert at all times, praying that you may have the strength to escape all these things about to happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”

37.verse: So during the days Yeshua was teaching in the Temple, but in the nights He went out and stayed on the Mount of Olives.

38.verse: And all the people would come early in the morning to hear Him in the Temple.

1.verse: The Day before Pesach - Now the Feast of Matzah, which is called Passover, was approaching.

2.verse: The ruling kohanim and Torah scholars were searching for a way to do away with Yeshua, for they were afraid of the people.

3.verse: Then satan entered into Judah, the one from Kriot, one of the twelve.

4.verse: And he went away and talked with the ruling kohanim and officers of the Temple guard about how he might deliver Yeshua over to them.

5.verse: They were delighted and agreed to give him money.

6.verse: So he agreed and began looking for a chance to hand Yeshua over to them without a crowd.

7.verse: Then came the day of matzah when the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

8.verse: Now Yeshua sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, so we may eat.”

9.verse: Then they said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare?”

10.verse: And He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters.

11.verse: And say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?”’

12.verse: And with that, he will show you a large upper room, fully furnished. Make preparations there.”

13.verse: So they left and found just what Yeshua had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

14.verse: The Seder in the Upper Room - When the hour came, Yeshua reclined at table, and the emissaries with Him.

15.verse: And He said to them, “I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

16.verse: For I tell you, I will never eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”

17.verse: And when He had taken a cup and offered the bracha, He said, “Take this and share it among yourselves.

18.verse: For I tell you that I will never drink of the fruit of the vine from now on, until the kingdom of God comes.”

19.verse: And when He had taken matzah and offered the bracha, He broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body, given for you. Do this in memory of Me.”

20.verse: In the same way, He took the cup after the meal, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood, which is poured out for you.

21.verse: But look, the hand of the one betraying Me is with Mine on the table.

22.verse: For indeed, the Son of Man is going as has been predetermined; but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!”

23.verse: So they began to discuss among themselves which of them it might be who would do this thing.

24.verse: But there was also a quarrel among them about which of them is considered the greatest.

25.verse: And Yeshua said to them, “The kings of the nations have mastery over them, and those exercising authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’

26.verse: But with you, it is not so. Rather, let the one who is greatest among you become like the youngest, and the one who leads like the one who serves.

27.verse: For who is greater, the one who reclines or the one who serves? Is it not the one who reclines? But I am among you as one who serves.

28.verse: “You are the ones who have remained with Me in My times of testing.

29.verse: And just as My Father has granted Me a kingdom, so I grant to you

30.verse: that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and you shall sit upon thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

31.verse: “Simon, Simon! Indeed, satan has demanded to sift you all like wheat.

32.verse: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith will not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.”

33.verse: But Simon said to Him, “Master, I am ready to go with You even to prison and to death!”

34.verse: But Yeshua said, “I tell you, Peter, a rooster will not crow today until you have denied three times that you know Me.”

35.verse: And He said to them, “When I sent you out without a money pouch and travel bag and sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?” They said, “No, nothing.”

36.verse: Then He said to them, “But now, whoever has a money pouch must carry it as well as a travel bag. And whoever does not own a sword must sell his cloak and buy one.

37.verse: For I tell you that this which is written must be fulfilled in Me: ‘And he was counted with the lawless.’ For what is written about Me is being fulfilled.”

38.verse: But they said, “Master, look here! Two swords!” And He said to them, “It is enough.”

39.verse: Yeshua Prays at the Mount of Olives - And Yeshua came out and went as usual to the Mount of Olives, and the disciples followed Him.

40.verse: When he reached the place, He said to them, “Pray that you will not enter into temptation.”

41.verse: And He pulled back about a stone’s throw from them, got on His knees, and began to pray,

42.verse: saying, “Father, if You are willing, take this cup from Me; yet not My will, but Yours be done.”

43.verse: Now an angel from heaven appeared to Him and strengthened Him.

44.verse: And in His anguish, He was praying fervently; and His sweat was like drops of blood falling down on the ground.

45.verse: When He rose up from prayer, He came to the disciples and found them asleep, exhausted from grief.

46.verse: And He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray, so that you won’t enter into temptation.”

47.verse: Betrayed! - While Yeshua was speaking, suddenly a crowd came, and the one called Judah, one of the Twelve, approached Yeshua to kiss Him.

48.verse: But Yeshua said to him, “Judah, with a kiss you betray the Son of Man?”

49.verse: When those around Him saw what was going to happen, they said to Him, “Master, shall we strike with the sword?”

50.verse: And one of them struck the servant of the kohen gadol and cut off his right ear.

51.verse: But Yeshua answered and said, “Stop this now!” And He touched the man’s ear and healed him.

52.verse: Then Yeshua said to the ruling kohanim, officers of the Temple guard, and the elders who had come against Him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as you would against a revolutionary?

53.verse: Every day I was with you in the Temple, yet you did not lay a finger on Me. But this is yours—the hour and the power of darkness.”

54.verse: Then they seized Yeshua and led Him away and brought Him into the house of the kohen gadol. But Peter was following from a distance.

55.verse: Denied Three Times - Now they had lit a fire in the center of the courtyard and sat down together, and Peter was sitting among them.

56.verse: Then a servant girl saw him sitting at the fire. She looked straight at him and said, “This one was with Him too!”

57.verse: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I don’t know Him!”

58.verse: A little later, another saw him and said, “You too are one of them.” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”

59.verse: And about an hour later, another began to insist, saying, “Certainly this fellow was with Him, for he too is a Galilean!”

60.verse: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you’re talking about!” And immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

61.verse: And the Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had told him, ‘Before the rooster crows today, you will deny Me three times.’

62.verse: And Peter went out and wept bitterly.

63.verse: Beaten by Roman Soldiers - Now the men who were guarding Yeshua began mocking and beating Him.

64.verse: They blindfolded Him and kept asking Him, saying, “Prophesy! Who is the one who hit You?”

65.verse: And reviling Him, they were saying many other things against Him.

66.verse: Brought Before the Council - As it become day, the elders of the people gathered together, both ruling kohanim and Torah scholars, and they led Him away to their council, saying,

67.verse: “If You are Mashiach, tell us.” But Yeshua said to them, “If I tell you, you will never believe;

68.verse: and if I ask you, you will never answer.

69.verse: But from now on, the Son of Man is seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

70.verse: Then they all said, “Are You then Ben-Elohim?” And to them He said, “You say that I am.”

71.verse: Then they said, “What further need do we have for testimony? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth!”

1.verse: Brought Before Pilate - Then the entire assembly got up and brought Yeshua to Pilate.

2.verse: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this fellow subverting our nation, forbidding payment of taxes to Caesar and saying that He Himself is Messiah—a king.”

3.verse: So Pilate questioned Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” “As you say,” Yeshua replied.

4.verse: Then Pilate said to the ruling kohanim and the crowds, “I find no case against this Man.”

5.verse: But they kept insisting, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, starting from the Galilee to as far as here.”

6.verse: But when Pilate heard this, he asked whether the Man was a Galilean.

7.verse: And when he learned that Yeshua was from Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.

8.verse: Brought Before Herod - Now Herod was overjoyed when he saw Yeshua, for he had wanted to see Him for a long time, because he had heard about Him and was hoping to see some miracle done by Him.

9.verse: He was questioning Yeshua on many issues, but Yeshua did not answer at all.

10.verse: And the ruling kohanim and the Torah scholars stood their ground, strongly accusing Him.

11.verse: Now Herod together with his soldiers were treating Him with contempt and mocking Him. They put splendid clothing on Him and sent Him back to Pilate.

12.verse: And Herod and Pilate became friends with one another from that very day, for previously they had been enemies with one another.

13.verse: Pilate’s Decree - Now Pilate called together the ruling kohanim, the leaders, and the people.

14.verse: And he said to them, “You brought this Man to me as one who incites the people to revolt. But having examined Him in your presence, I have found no case against this Man regarding what you accuse Him of doing.

15.verse: Nor did Herod, for he sent Him back to us. Indeed, He has done nothing that is worthy of death.

16.verse: Therefore I will scourge Him and release Him.”

18.verse: But they shouted out all together, saying, “Take this fellow away! Release to us Bar-Abba!”

19.verse: (He was someone who had been thrown into prison for a rebellion in the city and murder.)

20.verse: Again Pilate addressed them, wanting to release Yeshua;

21.verse: but they kept shouting out, saying, “Execute, execute Him!”

22.verse: And a third time he spoke to them, “Why? What evil has this One done? I have found in Him no fault deserving of death. Therefore, I will scourge and release Him.”

23.verse: But they were insistent, demanding with loud shouts that He be executed. And their voices prevailed.

24.verse: So Pilate decreed that their demand be put into effect.

25.verse: And He released the one they were asking for, the one thrown in jail for insurrection and murder. But he handed over Yeshua to their will.

26.verse: Executed on the Stake - As they led Him away, they grabbed a man, Simon of Cyrene, coming in from the countryside. They placed on him the cross-beam, to carry behind Yeshua.

27.verse: Now a great multitude of people was following Him, including women who were mourning and singing dirges for Him.

28.verse: But Yeshua, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me, but for yourselves and your children.

29.verse: For indeed, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are barren, and the wombs that never gave birth, and the breasts that did not feed.’

30.verse: ‘Then they will begin to say to the montains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’

31.verse: “For if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

32.verse: Others, two evildoers, were also led away to be put to death with Him.

33.verse: When they came to the place called the Skull, there they crucified Him and the evildoers, one on His right and the other on His left.

34.verse: But Yeshua was saying, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” Then they cast lots, dividing up His clothing.

35.verse: The people stood there watching. And even the leaders were sneering at Him, saying, “He saved others; let Him save Himself if He is the Messiah of God, the Chosen One!”

36.verse: The soldiers likewise mocked Him, coming up and bringing Him sour wine,

37.verse: and saying, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”

38.verse: Now there was also an inscription over Him: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

39.verse: One of the evildoers hanging there was jeering at Him, saying, “Aren’t You the Messiah? Save Yourself—and us!”

40.verse: But the other one, rebuking him, replied, “Don’t you fear God, since you are under the same sentence?

41.verse: We’re getting what we deserve for our actions, and rightly so—but this One has done nothing wrong.”

42.verse: And he said, “Yeshua, remember me when You come into Your kingdom.”

43.verse: Yeshua said to him, “Amen, I tell you, today you shall be with Me in Paradise.”

44.verse: Temple Curtain Torn in Two - It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness fell over the whole land until the ninth hour,

45.verse: for the sun died out. And the curtain of the Temple was torn in two.

46.verse: And Yeshua, crying out with a loud voice, said, “Father, ‘into Your hands I entrust My spirit.’” When He had said this, He breathed His last.

47.verse: Now when the centurion saw what had happened, he began glorifying God, saying, “Truly this was a righteous Man.”

48.verse: And all the crowds assembled for this spectacle, when they saw what had happened, began to turn back, beating their breasts.

49.verse: But all Yeshua’s acquaintances, and the women who were following Him from the Galilee, were standing at a distance, watching these things.

50.verse: Buried in a Rich Man’s Tomb - Now there was a man named Joseph, a council member, a good and righteous man.

51.verse: (He had not been in agreement with the council and their action.) He was from the Judean town of Arimathea, and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.

52.verse: This man went to Pilate and asked for Yeshua’s body.

53.verse: And he took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid Him in a tomb cut out of the rock, where no one had ever yet been laid.

54.verse: Now it was the Day of Preparation, and Shabbat was approaching.

55.verse: The women who had come with Him from the Galilee followed, and they saw the tomb and how His body was laid.

56.verse: Then they returned and prepared spices and perfumes. But on Shabbat they rested according to the commandment.

1.verse: Women Visit the Garden Tomb - Now on the first day of the week, at daybreak, the women came to the tomb, carrying the spices they had prepared.

2.verse: They found the stone had been rolled away from the tomb;

3.verse: but when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Yeshua.

4.verse: And while they were perplexed about this, suddenly two men in dazzling clothes stood beside them.

5.verse: The women were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, but the men said to them, “Why do you search for the living among the dead?

6.verse: He is not here, but He is risen! Remember what He told you when He was still in the Galilee,

7.verse: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be executed, and on the third day rise up.”

8.verse: And they were reminded of His words.

9.verse: And when they returned from the tomb, they told all these things to the eleven and to everyone else.

10.verse: Now it was Miriam from Magdala, Joanna, the Miriam of Jacob and others together with them who were telling these things to the emissaries.

11.verse: But these words appeared to them as nonsense, and they would not believe them.

12.verse: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Leaning in, he sees only the linen cloths. And he went away to his home, marveling at what had happened.

13.verse: Eyes Open in Emmaus - Now behold, two of them on that very day were traveling to a village named Emmaus, a distance of about seven miles from Jerusalem.

14.verse: They were speaking with one another about all the things that had been happening.

15.verse: While they were talking and discussing, Yeshua Himself approached and began traveling with them.

16.verse: But their eyes were kept from recognizing Him.

17.verse: Then He said to them, “What are these things you are discussing with one another as you are walking along?” They stood still, looking gloomy.

18.verse: Then the one named Cleopas answered and said to Him, “Are You the only one visiting Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that happened there in these days?”

19.verse: Yeshua said to them, “What kind of things?” And they said to Him, “The things about Yeshua from Natzeret, who was a Prophet, powerful in deed and word before God and all the people—

20.verse: how the ruling kohanim and our leaders handed Him over to be sentenced to death, and they executed Him.

21.verse: But we were hoping that He was the One about to redeem Israel. Besides all this, today is the third day since these things happened.

22.verse: “But also some women among us amazed us. Early in the morning they were at the tomb.

23.verse: When they didn’t find His body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said He is alive!

24.verse: Some of those with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women said, but they did not see Him.”

25.verse: Yeshua said to them, “Oh foolish ones, so slow of heart to put your trust in all that the prophets spoke!

26.verse: Was it not necessary for Messiah to suffer these things and to enter into His glory?”

27.verse: Then beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, He explained to them the things written about Himself in all the Scriptures.

28.verse: They approached the village where they were going, and He acted as though He were going farther on.

29.verse: But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is nearly evening and the day is already gone.” So He went in to stay with them.

30.verse: And it happened that when He was reclining at the table with them, He took the matzah, offered a bracha and, breaking it, gave it to them.

31.verse: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him, and He disappeared from them.

32.verse: Good News for the Disciples in Jerusalem - They said to one another, “Didn’t our heart burn within us while He was speaking with us on the road, while He was explaining the Scriptures to us?”

33.verse: And they got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. They found the eleven and others with them gathered together,

34.verse: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed! He has appeared to Simon!”

35.verse: Then they began telling about the events on the road and how He became recognized by them in the breaking of the matzah.

36.verse: While they were speaking of these things, Yeshua Himself stood in the midst of them and said, “Shalom Aleichem!”

37.verse: But they were startled and terrified, thinking they were seeing a ghost.

38.verse: Then He said to them, “Why are you so shaken? And why do doubts arise in your heart?

39.verse: Look at My hands and My feet—it is I Myself! Touch Me and see! For a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see I have.”

40.verse: And when He had said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.

41.verse: But while they were still in disbelief due to joy and wonder, He said to them, “Do you have anything to eat here?”

42.verse: They gave Him a piece of broiled fish,

43.verse: and He took it and ate it in their presence.

44.verse: Then He said to them, “These are My words which I spoke to you while I was still with you—everything written concerning Me in the Torah of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms must be fulfilled.

45.verse: Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures,

46.verse: and He said to them, “So it is written, that the Messiah is to suffer and to rise from the dead on the third day,

47.verse: and that repentance for the removal of sins is to be proclaimed in His name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.

48.verse: You are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: And behold, I am sending the promise of My Father upon you; but you are to stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”

50.verse: Yeshua Ascends into Heaven - Then Yeshua led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them.

51.verse: And while blessing them, He departed from them and was taken up into heaven.

52.verse: After worshiping Him, they returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

53.verse: And they were continually in the Temple, praising God.
